meanings.definition: To cut off the end of something
meanings.sent1: She docked the rope to make it shorter.
meanings.sent2: The tailor docked the pants to fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally docked the cake, making it smaller than intended.
meanings.sent4: The editor docked the article, removing unnecessary paragraphs.
meanings.sent5: The gardener docked the overgrown branches, shaping the tree beautifully.

meanings.definition: To shorten or reduce in size
meanings.sent1: He docked his speech to make it more concise.
meanings.sent2: The teacher docked the assignment for being too long.
meanings.sent3: The movie director docked the film, making it more fast-paced.
meanings.sent4: The tailor docked the dress, altering it to a smaller size.
meanings.sent5: She docked her hair, opting for a shorter style.

meanings.definition: To fasten a boat at a dock
meanings.sent1: The captain docked the ship carefully at the harbor.
meanings.sent2: We will dock the boat at the marina for the night.
meanings.sent3: The sailor docked the yacht swiftly, impressing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: They docked the canoe securely before going ashore.
meanings.sent5: She will dock the sailboat at the pier before heading home.
